clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used in the control of absence petit mal seizures that are refractory to treatment with other medications

contraindications.disease: Symptoms of overdose include clumsiness or unsteadiness coma dizziness severe drowsiness severe nausea severe and problems with vision
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Paramethadione and trimethadione are anticonvulsants indicated in the control of absence petit mal seizures that are refractory to treatment with other medications Dione anticonvulsants are used in the treatment of epilepsy They act on the central nervous system CNS to reduce the number of seizures
